text:
Instead of Zhukov, a memorial plaque to the fallen defenders of Ukraine will be installed on the wall of the Odessa regional military enlistment office

01 Nov 2019, 13:26

Instead of the bas-relief of Soviet Marshal Georgy Zhukov, dismantled on October 31 by activists of patriotic organizations, a memorial plaque will appear on the wall of the regional center for acquisition and social support (regional military enlistment office) for soldiers who fell in eastern Ukraine.
About this with reference to the press officer of the military enlistment office Anastasia Iliyash reports "Radio Liberty."



‚ÄúAt this place until December 6 (Day of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, - Ed.) It is planned to establish a memorial plaque in honor of the dead servicemen, residents of the Odessa region. We have more than 100 of them, ‚Äùshe said.
The draft board is already there, now it is being agreed upon, the press officer added.
According to her, the regional state administration insisted on dismantling the bas-relief: images of Zhukov, the USSR Minister of Defense and a member of the Presidium of the CPSU Central Committee, are subject to decommunization legislation. Earlier, the Regional State Administration demanded to remove him in 2016 and 2017. However, the military believes that the local authority should have removed the memorial sign.
Activists of patriotic organizations did this yesterday. Now the bas-relief is in the apartment of one of them.
Odessa Mayor Gennady Trukhanov and people's deputies from the "Servant of the People" Artem Dmitruk and Alexei Leonov condemned the actions of the patriots.
